meanings.definition: Capable of being raised or erected.
meanings.sent1: The erective flag fluttered proudly in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The crane had an erective arm that could lift heavy loads.
meanings.sent3: The erective umbrella refused to stay closed, much to the amusement of the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: His erective determination to succeed propelled him forward despite the obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The erective mountain peak stood majestically against the clear blue sky.

meanings.sent1: Her erective gaze made everyone in the room sit up straight.
meanings.sent2: The sunflower's erective stem reached towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The erective squirrel kept popping up to steal nuts, providing comic relief.
meanings.sent4: His erective ambition drove him to achieve great things.
meanings.sent5: The erective tree branches stretched out like welcoming arms.

meanings.sent1: The erective statue towered over the park visitors.
meanings.sent2: The erective buildings lined the bustling city streets.
meanings.sent3: The erective scarecrow scared more birds than it shooed away.
meanings.sent4: The erective lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The erective palm trees swayed gracefully in the ocean breeze.
